newsitem.title: JAPAN: Iran raises July term price for Iran Heavy - traders.
newsitem.headline: Iran raises July term price for Iran Heavy - traders.

text.p: State-owned National Iranian Oil Co (NIOC) has raised its July crude pricing formula for Iranian Heavy crude by 10 cents per barrel, while keeping the term price formula for Iranian Light unchanged, traders said on Wednesday.
Following the decision, Iranian Heavy for July loading will be priced at Dubai quotations minus 13 cents with an automatic adjustment factor then subtracted.
Iranian Light for July loading will be priced at Oman's MPM minus 27 cents, with an automatic adjustment factor added to that.
Iranian Heavy's June term price was set at Dubai minus 23 cents and Iranian Light's price at Oman minus 27 cents.
The term price of Iranian Heavy crude fluctuates in line with that of Saudi Arabia's Arab Medium, while Iranian Light reflects the movement of Arab Light term prices.
Iranian crude prices are set on a quarterly basis. However, under a contract agreement, NIOC and its customers can review prices whenever Saudi Arabian crude prices move substantially.
